introductions.S0001L01: Now, the Spanish for "I want" as in "I want to speak Spanish with you now." is "quiero", quiero.

introductions.S0053L03: The Spanish for "in her bag" as in "She wanted to put his letter in her bag." is "en su bolsa" - where "en" means "in", "su" means "her", and "bolsa" means "bag".
introductions.S0054L01: Now, the Spanish for "we wanted" as in "We wanted to give you a little more time." is "queríamos", queríamos.
introductions.S0054L02: Now, the Spanish for "to give you" as in "We wanted to give you a little more time." is "darte", darte.
introductions.S0054L03: The Spanish for "a little more time" as in "We wanted to give you a little more time." is "un poco más de tiempo" - where "un poco" means "a little", "más" means "more", "de" means "of", and "tiempo" means "time".
introductions.S0055L01: The Spanish for "I don't enjoy" as in "I don't enjoy waking up when I didn't sleep very well." is "no disfruto" - where "no" means "not" and "disfruto" means "I enjoy".
introductions.S0055L02: Now, the Spanish for "to wake up/waking up" as in "I don't enjoy waking up when I didn't sleep very well." is "despertarme", despertarme.
introductions.S0055L03: The Spanish for "I didn't sleep" as in "I don't enjoy waking up when I didn't sleep very well." is "no dormí" - where "no" means "not" and "dormí" means "I slept".
introductions.S0056L01: The Spanish for "so I can/to be able to" as in "So I can remember how to say a few words." is "para poder" - where "para" means "for/so" and "poder" means "to be able to/can".
introductions.S0056L02: The Spanish for "a few words" as in "So I can remember how to say a few words." is "unas pocas palabras" - where "unas" means "some", "pocas" means "few", and "palabras" means "words".
introductions.S0057L01: The Spanish for "I can't" as in "I can't remember how to say what I wanted to say." is "no puedo" - where "no" means "not" and "puedo" means "I can".
introductions.S0057L02: The Spanish for "what I wanted to say" as in "I can't remember how to say what I wanted to say." is "lo que quería decir" - where "lo que" means "what", "quería" means "I wanted", and "decir" means "to say".
introductions.S0058L01: The Spanish for "it's interesting" as in "It's interesting when you understand enough words." is "es interesante" - where "es" means "it is" and "interesante" means "interesting".
introductions.S0058L02: Now, the Spanish for "you understand" as in "It's interesting when you understand enough words." is "comprendes", comprendes.
introductions.S0058L03: The Spanish for "enough words" as in "It's interesting when you understand enough words." is "suficientes palabras" - where "suficientes" means "enough" and "palabras" means "words".
introductions.S0059L01: The Spanish for "I know how to do" as in "I know how to do what I need to do next week." is "sé hacer" - where "sé" means "I know" and "hacer" means "to do".
introductions.S0059L02: The Spanish for "what I need to do" as in "I know how to do what I need to do next week." is "lo que necesito hacer" - where "lo que" means "what", "necesito" means "I need", and "hacer" means "to do".
introductions.S0059L03: The Spanish for "next week" as in "I know how to do what I need to do next week." is "la próxima semana" - where "la" means "the", "próxima" means "next", and "semana" means "week".
introductions.S0060L01: The Spanish for "I don't know yet" as in "I don't know how to say enough different words yet." is "todavía no sé" - where "todavía" means "yet/still", "no" means "not", and "sé" means "I know".
introductions.S0060L02: The Spanish for "enough different words" as in "I don't know how to say enough different words yet." is "suficientes palabras diferentes" - where "suficientes" means "enough", "palabras" means "words", and "diferentes" means "different".
introductions.S0061L01: Now, the Spanish for "could you/you could" as in "Could you say that again a little more slowly?" is "podrías", podrías.
introductions.S0061L02: Now, the Spanish for "that" as in "Could you say that again a little more slowly?" is "eso", eso.
introductions.S0061L03: The Spanish for "again" as in "Could you say that again a little more slowly?" is "otra vez" - where "otra" means "another" and "vez" means "time".
introductions.S0061L04: The Spanish for "a little more slowly" as in "Could you say that again a little more slowly?" is "un poco más lentamente" - where "un poco" means "a little", "más" means "more", and "lentamente" means "slowly".
introductions.S0062L02: The Spanish for "I can help you" as in "I'm not sure if I can help you at the same time." is "puedo ayudarte" - where "puedo" means "I can" and "ayudarte" means "to help you".
introductions.S0062L03: The Spanish for "at the same time" as in "I'm not sure if I can help you at the same time." is "al mismo tiempo" - where "al" means "at the", "mismo" means "same", and "tiempo" means "time".
introductions.S0063L01: The Spanish for "you are sure" as in "Are you sure you don't mind helping me?" is "estás seguro" - where "estás" means "you are" and "seguro" means "sure".
introductions.S0063L02: The Spanish for "that you don't mind" as in "Are you sure you don't mind helping me?" is "de que no te importa" - where "de que" means "that", "no" means "not", "te" means "you", and "importa" means "mind/matters".
introductions.S0064L01: The Spanish for "learning Spanish" as in "Learning Spanish isn't easy but it is fun." is "aprender español" - where "aprender" means "to learn" and "español" means "Spanish".
introductions.S0064L02: The Spanish for "isn't easy" as in "Learning Spanish isn't easy but it is fun." is "no es fácil" - where "no" means "not", "es" means "it is", and "fácil" means "easy".
introductions.S0064L03: The Spanish for "it is fun" as in "Learning Spanish isn't easy but it is fun." is "es divertido" - where "es" means "it is" and "divertido" means "fun".
introductions.S0065L01: The Spanish for "it's important" as in "It's important to take time to test yourself." is "es importante" - where "es" means "it is" and "importante" means "important".
introductions.S0065L02: The Spanish for "to take time" as in "It's important to take time to test yourself." is "tomar tiempo" - where "tomar" means "to take" and "tiempo" means "time".
introductions.S0065L03: The Spanish for "to test yourself" as in "It's important to take time to test yourself." is "para evaluarte" - where "para" means "to/for" and "evaluarte" means "to test yourself".
introductions.S0066L01: The Spanish for "it's not difficult" as in "It's not difficult to find the answer." is "no es difícil" - where "no" means "not", "es" means "it is", and "difícil" means "difficult".
introductions.S0066L03: The Spanish for "the answer" as in "It's not difficult to find the answer." is "la respuesta" - where "la" means "the" and "respuesta" means "answer".
introductions.S0067L03: Now, the Spanish for "to stop" as in "Why do you want to stop?" is "parar", parar.
introductions.S0068L01: Now, the Spanish for "what" as in "What are you looking for?" is "qué", qué.
introductions.S0068L02: The Spanish for "are you looking for" as in "What are you looking for?" is "estás buscando" - where "estás" means "you are" and "buscando" means "looking for".
introductions.S0069L01: The Spanish for "I didn't want/he didn't want" as in "He didn't want to look after the young dog all afternoon." is "no quería" - where "no" means "not" and "quería" means "I wanted/he wanted".
introductions.S0069L02: Now, the Spanish for "to look after" as in "He didn't want to look after the young dog all afternoon." is "cuidar", cuidar.
introductions.S0069L03: The Spanish for "the young dog" as in "He didn't want to look after the young dog all afternoon." is "el perro joven" - where "el" means "the", "perro" means "dog", and "joven" means "young".
introductions.S0069L04: The Spanish for "all afternoon" as in "He didn't want to look after the young dog all afternoon." is "toda la tarde" - where "toda" means "all", "la" means "the", and "tarde" means "afternoon".
introductions.S0070L02: Now, the Spanish for "to tell me" as in "She didn't want to tell me where it was." is "decirme", decirme.
introductions.S0070L03: The Spanish for "where it was" as in "She didn't want to tell me where it was." is "dónde estaba" - where "dónde" means "where" and "estaba" means "it was".
introductions.S0071L01: The Spanish for "we didn't want" as in "We didn't want to let anyone hear the truth." is "no queríamos" - where "no" means "not" and "queríamos" means "we wanted".
introductions.S0071L02: The Spanish for "to let/allow that" as in "We didn't want to let anyone hear the truth." is "permitir que" - where "permitir" means "to allow" and "que" means "that".
introductions.S0071L03: Now, the Spanish for "no one/nobody" as in "We didn't want to let anyone hear the truth." is "nadie", nadie.
introductions.S0071L04: Now, the Spanish for "hear" as in "We didn't want to let anyone hear the truth." is "oyera", oyera.
introductions.S0071L05: The Spanish for "the truth" as in "We didn't want to let anyone hear the truth." is "la verdad" - where "la" means "the" and "verdad" means "truth".
introductions.S0072L01: The Spanish for "you're doing" as in "I think that you're doing very well." is "estás haciendo" - where "estás" means "you are" and "haciendo" means "doing".
introductions.S0073L01: The Spanish for "thank you very much" as in "Thank you very much, but I've got more to learn." is "muchas gracias" - where "muchas" means "many" and "gracias" means "thanks".
introductions.S0073L02: The Spanish for "I've got more to learn" as in "Thank you very much, but I've got more to learn." is "tengo más que aprender" - where "tengo" means "I have", "más" means "more", "que" means "that/to", and "aprender" means "to learn".
introductions.S0074L01: The Spanish for "for helping me" as in "Thank you very much for helping me to understand." is "por ayudarme" - where "por" means "for" and "ayudarme" means "helping me".
introductions.S0074L02: The Spanish for "to understand" as in "Thank you very much for helping me to understand." is "a comprender" - where "a" means "to" and "comprender" means "to understand".
introductions.S0075L01: The Spanish for "have you got more to learn" as in "Have you got more to learn?" is "tienes más que aprender" - where "tienes" means "you have", "más" means "more", "que" means "that/to", and "aprender" means "to learn".
introductions.S0076L01: The Spanish for "I'm very happy" as in "I'm very happy with how much I've learnt already." is "estoy muy feliz" - where "estoy" means "I am", "muy" means "very", and "feliz" means "happy".
introductions.S0076L02: The Spanish for "with how much" as in "I'm very happy with how much I've learnt already." is "con cuánto" - where "con" means "with" and "cuánto" means "how much".
introductions.S0076L03: The Spanish for "I've learnt" as in "I'm very happy with how much I've learnt already." is "he aprendido" - where "he" means "I have" and "aprendido" means "learnt".
introductions.S0076L04: Now, the Spanish for "already" as in "I'm very happy with how much I've learnt already." is "ya", ya.
introductions.S0077L01: The Spanish for "I'm surprised" as in "I'm surprised at how quickly I'm starting to understand." is "estoy sorprendido" - where "estoy" means "I am" and "sorprendido" means "surprised".
introductions.S0077L02: The Spanish for "at how quickly" as in "I'm surprised at how quickly I'm starting to understand." is "de lo rápidamente que" - where "de" means "at/of", "lo" means "the", "rápidamente" means "quickly", and "que" means "that".
introductions.S0077L03: The Spanish for "I'm starting to" as in "I'm surprised at how quickly I'm starting to understand." is "estoy comenzando a" - where "estoy" means "I am", "comenzando" means "starting", and "a" means "to".
introductions.S0077L04: Now, the Spanish for "to understand" as in "I'm surprised at how quickly I'm starting to understand." is "comprender", comprender.
introductions.S0078L01: The Spanish for "I don't understand" as in "I don't understand what you said." is "no comprendo" - where "no" means "not" and "comprendo" means "I understand".
introductions.S0078L02: The Spanish for "what you said" as in "I don't understand what you said." is "lo que dijiste" - where "lo que" means "what" and "dijiste" means "you said".
introductions.S0079L01: Now, the Spanish for "when" as in "When did you start to learn?" is "cuándo", cuándo.
introductions.S0079L02: The Spanish for "did you start to learn" as in "When did you start to learn?" is "comenzaste a aprender" - where "comenzaste" means "you started", "a" means "to", and "aprender" means "to learn".
introductions.S0080L01: The Spanish for "of when" as in "I'm not sure when I'll be ready." is "de cuándo" - where "de" means "of" and "cuándo" means "when".
introductions.S0080L02: The Spanish for "I'll be ready" as in "I'm not sure when I'll be ready." is "estaré preparado" - where "estaré" means "I will be" and "preparado" means "ready".
introductions.S0081L01: Now, the Spanish for "to start" as in "When do you want to start?" is "comenzar", comenzar.
introductions.S0082L02: Now, the Spanish for "to wait for you" as in "I'm not going to wait for you. Why not?" is "esperarte", esperarte.
introductions.S0082L03: The Spanish for "why not" as in "I'm not going to wait for you. Why not?" is "por qué no" - where "por qué" means "why" and "no" means "not".
introductions.S0083L01: The Spanish for "I agree" as in "I agree with what you said about your friend." is "estoy de acuerdo" - where "estoy" means "I am" and "de acuerdo" means "in agreement".
introductions.S0083L02: The Spanish for "with what you said" as in "I agree with what you said about your friend." is "con lo que dijiste" - where "con" means "with", "lo que" means "what", and "dijiste" means "you said".
introductions.S0083L03: The Spanish for "about your friend" as in "I agree with what you said about your friend." is "sobre tu amigo" - where "sobre" means "about", "tu" means "your", and "amigo" means "friend".
introductions.S0084L01: The Spanish for "I don't agree" as in "I don't agree with what he said about my friend." is "no estoy de acuerdo" - where "no" means "not" and "estoy de acuerdo" means "I agree".
introductions.S0084L02: The Spanish for "with what he said" as in "I don't agree with what he said about my friend." is "con lo que dijo" - where "con" means "with", "lo que" means "what", and "dijo" means "he said".
introductions.S0084L03: The Spanish for "about my friend" as in "I don't agree with what he said about my friend." is "sobre mi amigo" - where "sobre" means "about", "mi" means "my", and "amigo" means "friend".
introductions.S0085L01: The Spanish for "I don't know" as in "I don't know those people." is "no conozco" - where "no" means "not" and "conozco" means "I know".
introductions.S0085L02: The Spanish for "those people" as in "I don't know those people." is "a esas personas" - where "a" means "to", "esas" means "those", and "personas" means "people".
introductions.S0086L01: The Spanish for "it wasn't possible" as in "It wasn't possible, unfortunately." is "no fue posible" - where "no" means "not", "fue" means "it was", and "posible" means "possible".
introductions.S0086L02: Now, the Spanish for "unfortunately" as in "It wasn't possible, unfortunately." is "desafortunadamente", desafortunadamente.
introductions.S0087L01: The Spanish for "they are people" as in "They are people I don't know." is "son personas" - where "son" means "they are" and "personas" means "people".
introductions.S0087L02: The Spanish for "that I don't know" as in "They are people I don't know." is "que no conozco" - where "que" means "that" and "no conozco" means "I don't know".
introductions.S0088L01: The Spanish for "I'm not ready" as in "I'm not ready to talk to people I don't know yet." is "no estoy preparado" - where "no" means "not", "estoy" means "I am", and "preparado" means "ready".
introductions.S0088L02: The Spanish for "to talk" as in "I'm not ready to talk to people I don't know yet." is "para hablar" - where "para" means "to/for" and "hablar" means "to talk".
introductions.S0088L03: The Spanish for "to people I don't know" as in "I'm not ready to talk to people I don't know yet." is "con personas que no conozco" - where "con" means "with", "personas" means "people", "que" means "that", and "no conozco" means "I don't know".
introductions.S0088L04: Now, the Spanish for "yet" as in "I'm not ready to talk to people I don't know yet." is "todavía", todavía.
introductions.S0089L01: The Spanish for "I've done" as in "I think that I've done a lot in a short time." is "he hecho" - where "he" means "I have" and "hecho" means "done".
introductions.S0089L02: Now, the Spanish for "a lot" as in "I think that I've done a lot in a short time." is "mucho", mucho.
introductions.S0089L03: The Spanish for "in a short time" as in "I think that I've done a lot in a short time." is "en un breve tiempo" - where "en" means "in", "un" means "a", "breve" means "short", and "tiempo" means "time".
introductions.S0090L01: The Spanish for "you can speak" as in "If you can speak more slowly that would be great." is "puedes hablar" - where "puedes" means "you can" and "hablar" means "to speak".
introductions.S0090L02: The Spanish for "more slowly" as in "If you can speak more slowly that would be great." is "más lentamente" - where "más" means "more" and "lentamente" means "slowly".
introductions.S0090L04: The Spanish for "would be great" as in "If you can speak more slowly that would be great." is "sería excelente" - where "sería" means "would be" and "excelente" means "great/excellent".
introductions.S0091L01: The Spanish for "it's difficult" as in "It's difficult to think quickly enough to answer in time." is "es difícil" - where "es" means "it is" and "difícil" means "difficult".
introductions.S0091L03: The Spanish for "quickly enough" as in "It's difficult to think quickly enough to answer in time." is "lo suficientemente rápido" - where "lo" means "the", "suficientemente" means "sufficiently", and "rápido" means "quickly".
introductions.S0091L05: The Spanish for "in time" as in "It's difficult to think quickly enough to answer in time." is "a tiempo" - where "a" means "in/on" and "tiempo" means "time".
introductions.S0092L01: The Spanish for "to keep on doing" as in "I'd like to keep on doing this for a while." is "continuar haciendo" - where "continuar" means "to continue" and "haciendo" means "doing".
introductions.S0092L02: Now, the Spanish for "this" as in "I'd like to keep on doing this for a while." is "esto", esto.
introductions.S0092L03: The Spanish for "for a while" as in "I'd like to keep on doing this for a while." is "por un tiempo" - where "por" means "for", "un" means "a", and "tiempo" means "time".
introductions.S0093L01: The Spanish for "it's time to" as in "It's time to go now." is "es hora de" - where "es" means "it is", "hora" means "time", and "de" means "to/of".
introductions.S0093L02: Now, the Spanish for "to go" as in "It's time to go now." is "ir", ir.
introductions.S0094L01: The Spanish for "this is" as in "This is the only way it will work." is "esta es" - where "esta" means "this" and "es" means "is".
introductions.S0094L02: The Spanish for "the only way" as in "This is the only way it will work." is "la única manera" - where "la" means "the", "única" means "only", and "manera" means "way".
introductions.S0094L03: The Spanish for "it will work" as in "This is the only way it will work." is "en que funcionará" - where "en que" means "in which" and "funcionará" means "it will work".
introductions.S0095L01: The Spanish for "you are ready" as in "Are you ready to go home on the next bus?" is "estás preparado" - where "estás" means "you are" and "preparado" means "ready".
introductions.S0095L03: The Spanish for "home" as in "Are you ready to go home on the next bus?" is "a casa" - where "a" means "to" and "casa" means "home".
introductions.S0095L04: The Spanish for "on the next bus" as in "Are you ready to go home on the next bus?" is "en el próximo autobús" - where "en" means "on", "el" means "the", "próximo" means "next", and "autobús" means "bus".
introductions.S0096L01: Now, the Spanish for "no" as in "No I'm not ready yet, I need a little more time." is "no", no.
introductions.S0097L01: Now, the Spanish for "yes" as in "Yes I'm ready to go as soon as you want." is "sí", sí.
introductions.S0097L02: The Spanish for "I'm ready" as in "Yes I'm ready to go as soon as you want." is "estoy preparado" - where "estoy" means "I am" and "preparado" means "ready".
introductions.S0097L03: The Spanish for "as soon as you want" as in "Yes I'm ready to go as soon as you want." is "tan pronto como quieras" - where "tan" means "as", "pronto" means "soon", "como" means "as", and "quieras" means "you want".
introductions.S0098L01: Now, the Spanish for "I should" as in "I should consider playing something else." is "debería", debería.
introductions.S0098L02: Now, the Spanish for "to consider" as in "I should consider playing something else." is "considerar", considerar.
introductions.S0098L03: Now, the Spanish for "to play" as in "I should consider playing something else." is "jugar", jugar.
introductions.S0098L04: The Spanish for "something else" as in "I should consider playing something else." is "otra cosa" - where "otra" means "another" and "cosa" means "thing".
introductions.S0099L01: Now, the Spanish for "you should" as in "You should ask yourself why it's not working." is "deberías", deberías.
introductions.S0099L03: The Spanish for "it's not working" as in "You should ask yourself why it's not working." is "no está trabajando" - where "no" means "not", "está" means "it is", and "trabajando" means "working".
introductions.S0100L01: The Spanish for "you shouldn't" as in "You shouldn't worry about doing something similar." is "no deberías" - where "no" means "not" and "deberías" means "you should".
introductions.S0100L02: Now, the Spanish for "to worry" as in "You shouldn't worry about doing something similar." is "preocuparte", preocuparte.
introductions.S0100L03: The Spanish for "about doing" as in "You shouldn't worry about doing something similar." is "por hacer" - where "por" means "about" and "hacer" means "doing".
introductions.S0100L04: The Spanish for "something similar" as in "You shouldn't worry about doing something similar." is "algo similar" - where "algo" means "something" and "similar" means "similar".
